intro: Unona desmos var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered unona, is a variant of the unona species characterized by its larger, showy flowers. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant typically features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow blooms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
